uist-5.sentence: Navigating stairs is a dangerous mobility challenge for people with low vision, who have a visual impairment that falls short of blindness.
uist-5.label: Background

uist-5.sentence: Prior research contributed systems for stair navigation that provide audio or tactile feedback, but people with low vision have usable vision and dont typically use nonvisual aids.
uist-5.label: Background

uist-5.sentence: We designed visualizations for a projection-based AR platform and smartglasses, considering the different characteristics of these platforms.
uist-5.label: Background

uist-5.sentence: We conducted the first exploration of augmented reality (AR) visualizations to facilitate stair navigation for people with low vision.
uist-5.label: Background

uist-5.sentence: For projection-based AR, we designed visual highlights that are projected directly on the stairs.
uist-5.label: Method

uist-5.sentence: In contrast, for smartglasses that have a limited vertical field of view, we designed visualizations that indicate the users position on the stairs, without directly augmenting the stairs themselves.
uist-5.label: Method

uist-5.sentence: Our designs on both platforms largely increased participants self-reported psychological security.
uist-5.label: Result

uist-5.sentence: Accessibility; augmented reality; low vision; visualization.
uist-5.label: Other

uist-5.sentence: We evaluated our visualizations on each platform with 12 people with low vision, finding that the visualizations for projection-based AR increased participants walking speed.
uist-5.label: Result
